meanings.definition: To place (cremated remains) in an urn.
meanings.sent1: She carefully inurned the ashes of her beloved pet in a beautiful urn.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to inurn the ashes of their loved one in a peaceful garden.
meanings.sent3: After the mix-up at the funeral home, they accidentally inurned the wrong ashes.
meanings.sent4: The memories of her childhood were inurned in the old family urn.
meanings.sent5: The act of inurning the ashes symbolized closure and remembrance for the family.

meanings.definition: To inter (cremated remains) in an urn.
meanings.sent1: The cemetery inurned the ashes of the deceased in a special section for urns.
meanings.sent2: They chose to inurn the ashes of their grandmother in a peaceful mausoleum.
meanings.sent3: In a strange turn of events, they accidentally inurned the ashes in the wrong family plot.
meanings.sent4: The love they shared was inurned together in a single urn, forever united.
meanings.sent5: The act of inurning the ashes brought a sense of peace and closure to the family.
